resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

   This doesn't fix the installed LZ4 not being detected in the first place, however.

lidavidm commented on pull request #11157:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11157#issuecomment-919517897


   By comparing with the libzstd finder (which succeeds) the difference appears to be the following: 
   
   In libzstd.pc, we have `libdir=${prefix}/lib` while in liblz4.pc, we have `libdir=/mingw64/lib`. It appears CMake can only properly search the former path, which resolves to a Windows-style path, not one of MinGW's fake Unix paths.


-- 
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

lidavidm commented on pull request #11157:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11157#issuecomment-919520957


   Comparing the packages, pkg-config did change. The commit is https://github.com/msys2/MINGW-packages/commit/4861bb970cb99879939033fe9cfbcfc841d49402 but it seems this shouldn't have an effect? The patch removed there was upstreamed in 1.8.0.


--

   Building and installing pkg-config 1.7 in MinGW also fixes it, so there's likely some regression in 1.8?

kou commented on a change in pull request #11157:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11157#discussion_r708753712



##########
File path: cpp/build-support/build-lz4-lib.sh
##########
@@ -17,9 +17,14 @@
 # specific language governing permissions and limitations
 # under the License.
 #
+MAKE="make"
+if [ -n "$MSYSTEM" ]; then
+  MAKE="mingw32-make"
+fi

Review comment:
       How about setting correct `PATH` such as `PATH=/mingw32/bin:$PATH` by user instead of this?




-- 
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

lidavidm commented on a change in pull request #11157:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11157#discussion_r708758482



##########
File path: cpp/build-support/build-lz4-lib.sh
##########
@@ -17,9 +17,14 @@
 # specific language governing permissions and limitations
 # under the License.
 #
+MAKE="make"
+if [ -n "$MSYSTEM" ]; then
+  MAKE="mingw32-make"
+fi

Review comment:
       I found that the mingw-w64-x86_64-make package doesn't install `make` but rather `mingw32-make`, unfortunately. (And from what I understand, the msys2 make package shouldn't be mixed with the mingw toolchain we use here.)




--

kou commented on pull request #11157:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11157#issuecomment-920395676


   Recent LZ4 supports CMake build: https://github.com/lz4/lz4/tree/dev/build/cmake
   How about using it instead of raw `make` build support? Then we don't need to add this workaround.


--

lidavidm commented on pull request #11157:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11157#issuecomment-920904030


   Actually, does that make sense? The CMake build support isn't in any LZ4 release; we're already on the latest, v1.9.3, which doesn't include that yet. Do we want to depend on an unreleased LZ4 version?


--

pitrou commented on pull request #11157:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11157#issuecomment-921059810


   The CMake support in LZ4 is probably quite young and my fear is that it will take some time to stabilize. I think this PR is fine in the meantime, and we can open a followup JIRA to switch to CMake in e.g. 6 months.


--

kou commented on pull request #11157:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11157#issuecomment-921266077


   FYI: CMake support is included in 1.9.3:
   
   ```console
   $ find lz4-1.9.3 | grep CMakeLists.txt
   lz4-1.9.3/build/cmake/CMakeLists.txt
   ```
   
   https://github.com/lz4/lz4/archive/v1.9.3.tar.gz

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: Recently the MinGW builds have been failing when trying to build LZ4. For some reason, CMake no longer finds the preinstalled version. (This I cannot replicate locally.) But while it should just fall back to building the local version, this fails because make is not installed.
fields.summary: [C++][CI] Make must be installed to build LZ4 on MinGW
